href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/200131-what-is-community.html#_1\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<p><a href=\"https://shimo.im/docs/KWxwgtpwGQxYv6Gw\">鼠年话开源-系列主题网聊</a></p> \n<ul> \n <li>第6夜是俺发起的议题</li> \n <li>没想到是个错误的议题,&nbsp;几句聊明白后</li> \n <li>引发出更加有意思的讨论…</li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"_2\">触发<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/200131-what-is-community.html#_2\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<blockquote> \n <p>其中追本溯源的灵魂一问,&nbsp;导入一本奇书中的论述</p> \n</blockquote> \n<p><span class=\"quo\">‘</span> 姜宁: https://github.com/open-organization-ambassadors/open-org-workbook/blob/master/open_org_workbook_1_1_5.pdf 222 页有一篇文章 community和open source community的论述,大家可以参考一下.&nbsp;‘</p> \n<hr> \n <p><span class=\"quo\">‘</span> 姜宁: 里面提到一个概念,就是Open Communities 也不是绝对的Open .&nbsp;‘</p> \n <hr> \n  <p><span class=\"quo\">‘</span> 姜宁: open communities are a broader implementation of open source communities.&nbsp;‘</p> \n  <hr> \n   <h2 id=\"_3\">快译<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/200131-what-is-community.html#_3\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n   <blockquote> \n    <p>尝试将要点翻译一下…</p> \n   </blockquote> \n   <p>什么是社区?&nbsp;…以往…现在互联网社区越来越重要…</p> \n   <p><span class=\"dquo\">“</span>社区”是指关系;它是成员与其共享的价值和活动系统之间的连接媒介. 换句话说,这是人员,工具和其他元素相互联系和互动的方式. 这一点很重要.&nbsp;社区不仅仅是一群无定形的人…</p> \n   <p>什么是开放社区?</p> \n   <p>-&gt;&nbsp;专门指开源技术社区了…其次,这些社区产生的源代码是”开放的”,这意味着社区和公众都可以使用和修改它. </p> \n   <p>进一步的,&nbsp;开源技术社区也只是开放社区首批实例化的社区…</p> \n   <p>以往是专有软件为王,&nbsp;现在开源软件在兴起…</p> \n   <p>更简单地讲,开放社区发展所遵循的共同价值观和信念不仅与它所做的事情有关,而且还与它如何做事有关. </p> \n   <p>功勋主义&nbsp;是很多开源社区的核心价值观…</p> \n   <p>开放社区主要通过成员的参与进行管理,而不是由指定的社区主持人进行管理(尽管可能有一个社区主持人,其作用是根据社区的精英和其他价值观来调解纠纷或进行适度的讨论). 所有成员的参与都是为了使社区的目标和行为社会化.&nbsp;例如,在开放社区中,围绕”协作”,”多样性”,”适应性”,”透明性”或”功勋”的价值观形成,所有成员都有责任防止和报告骚扰或任何可能破坏这些骚扰的行为价值观. </p> \n   <h2 id=\"_4\">反思<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/200131-what-is-community.html#_4\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n   <p>6年前私人偏见是这样的:</p> \n   <p><a href=\"https://devrel.101.camp/2014-02/ac2-tech-community/\">关 乎社群:2 什么是技术社区? | DevRel |&nbsp;开发者关系.思考</a></p> \n   <p>今天, 从开源技术社区开始, 逐渐获得社会认可, 进而衍生出更加宽泛的开放社区; 对比开源技术社区,&nbsp;相同的是:</p> \n   <ul> \n    <li>核心目标作品</li> \n    <li>开放/对等/主动的协作机制</li> \n    <li>…</li> \n   </ul> \n   <p>问题是,&nbsp;国外学术界/商界都在积累观察/参与/讨论/分析/…开源引发的开放社区协作…</p> \n   <p>而中国互联网全员关注的只是 996&nbsp;福报…</p> \n   <p>那么, 作为微小的个人,&nbsp;可以为之作什么?</p> \n   <ul> \n    <li>发起/运营/参与/服务各种开放社区</li> \n    <li>积累贡献经验,&nbsp;观察/总结中国式协作技巧</li> \n    <li>切实通过实践影响到具体的一个个人</li> \n    <li>慢慢的, 传递开来,&nbsp;就能形成切实的影响力以及组织/团体/社区/共同体/…</li> \n   </ul> \n   <h2 id=\"_5\">原文<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/200131-what-is-community.html#_5\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n   <p><a href=\"https://github.com/open-organization-ambassadors/open-org-workbook/\">open-organization-ambassadors/open-org-workbook: Repository for open organization community’s&nbsp;workbook</a></p> \n   <p>p222~224</p> \n   <blockquote> \n    <p>Introduction:</p> \n   </blockquote> \n   <p><strong>What is&nbsp;community?</strong></p> \n   <p>Heidi Hess von&nbsp;Ludewig</p> \n   <p>The term “community” refers to a sense of shared ownership and purpose that generates relationships of goodwill and fel- lowship between the members of a social&nbsp;network.</p> \n   <p><span class=\"dquo\">“</span>A community” is a speci c social network united according to shared values, beliefs, and goals. In recent years (and especially since the widespread adoption of internet technologies and appli- cations), the term “community” has taken on renewed importance. Communities exist wherever people can connect—face-to-face, in shared space, or even virtually, through analog or digital media (like as ham or <span class=\"caps\">CB</span> radio) or social networking applications (like Facebook). Social communities often center around religion, poli- tics, culture, geographical location, or interests. In professional and business realms, communities can be comprised of members who have similar knowledge, professions, or work roles (for in- stance, software coding, lawyers, or project managers). Research on communities has found that they provide support, enlarge net- works by enabling weak and strong network ties, disseminate information, and provide education and&nbsp;mentorship.</p> \n   <p>But they do something else, too: Communities de ne modes of behavior, beliefs, and roles, and in this way foster relationships between people. “Community” refers to the relationships; it is the connective medium between members and their shared value and activity systems. In other words, it’s the way that people, tools, and other elements relate and engage with one another. This point is important. Communities are not just amorphous globs of&nbsp;people</p> \n   <p>stuck together with some beliefs; they consist of relationships that develop between and among community members and elements. Those relationships are what constitute the community; the rela- tionships make possible the feeling of fellowship and positive association between members, the activities they perform, and the way they perform&nbsp;them.</p> \n   <p>Communities—how they’re constructed, the tools they use, how they operate—in uence the ways members connect (how they develop relationships between each other and establish relation- ships to the community at large), and the community purpose and value system is the reason those members connect. In this sense, then, the reason a community exists, how it decides to design and structure itself, the tools it decides to use, the information it dis- plays to instruct and guide members, and the people who join and participate in the community are all important considerations in building an open community, because each of these factors in u- ences the&nbsp;others.</p> \n   <p><strong>What are open&nbsp;communities?</strong></p> \n   <p>So-called “open communities” are an o shoot of open source software communities. The term “open” in “open source commu- nity” has dual meanings. First, in open source communities, community participation is “open,” meaning that anyone can join the community and participate in its activities. Second, the source code these communities produce is “open,” meaning that both the community and the general public can use and modify&nbsp;it.</p> \n   <p>At the time open source communities were created, “open” was a very new concept—one in direct opposition to prevailing wis- dom in the software industry, where proprietary software (creation, use, and access controlled by the owners of the intellectual prop- erty) was predominant. Open source communities, therefore, were among the rst enactment of open communities and were focused on creating software. Today, however, open communities are a broader implementation of open source&nbsp;communities.</p> \n   <p>While all communities function in ways that align with the beliefs and values of the group, some are more explicit and deliberately re exive about the values that guide their operation. Open communities are one example of this approach to community; they concern themselves with how a community should operate. In this way, open communities foster a particular kind of relationship and bond between its members, and—in the truest sense—encourage the development of specialized activities that are supportive of its values and beliefs. More simply, the shared values and beliefs around which an open community develops has to do not only with what it does but how it does what it&nbsp;does.</p> \n   <p>For example, at the heart of many open communities is the value of “meritocracy,” which members invoke to stress evaluation of ideas and work based on the intrinsic value of the work to the community and not on the value of the people performing the activ- ity. Other key attributes of an open community are transparency, inclusivity, adaptability, and collaboration. These shared qualities help spur the self-organizing nature of an open community. The rel- ative level of a community’s degree of inclusivity, adaptability, collaboration and transparency determines that community’s de- gree of&nbsp;“openness.”</p> \n   <p>Open communities are managed predominantly through members’ participation, rather than by a designated community moderator (though there may be a community moderator whose role is intended to mediate disputes or moderate discussions based on the meritocracy and other values of the community). All mem- bers participate in order to socialize the goals and behaviors of the community; for instance, in open communities are formed around values like “collaboration,” “diversity,” “adaptability,” “trans - parency,” or “meritocracy,” all members are responsible for preventing and reporting harassment or any behavior that might negate these&nbsp;values.</p> \n   <p>Since open communities are especially concerned with how they operate, they are often able to use their shared values to in- form decision-making practices and evaluate contributions. Members therefore possess a common language for working to- gether, are able to use that language and standard of behavior to participate in collaborative work, consistently model the behaviors that align with the shared values, and—perhaps most importantly— are accountable for their actions (and trust other community mem- bers to also be&nbsp;accountable).</p> \n   <p>…</p> \n  </hr> \n </hr> <p>随心小累</p> \n</blockquote> \n<h2 id=\"_3\">随心<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/141209-feeling-leo.html#_3\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<ul> \n <li> <p>目录/文件/模块/函式/代码块/片段/配置/测试数据….&nbsp;一切都在一个界面中可以快速编辑</p> </li> \n <li> <p>保存到哪儿也只是一行声明的事儿</p> </li> \n <li> <p>所有代码的 提纲结构, 就是我对程序的理解,&nbsp;完全无视所有语法结构,可以任意随手设定</p> </li> \n <li> <p>无论何时回到思考场景,上次对程序的思考进展都以&nbsp;提纲节点树的形式存在着</p> </li> \n <li> <p>同时, “混出” 的代码又完全干净, 标准的代码文本,&nbsp;不影响任何环境中的运行</p> </li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"_4\">小累<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/141209-feeling-leo.html#_4\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<ul> \n <li> <p>Leo 是 纯 Python 编写的编辑环境,&nbsp;加载/迁移都有点小麻烦</p> </li> \n <li> <p>而且没有很多现代 <span class=\"caps\">IDE</span> 的各种自动化功能, 就连语法颜色也无法&nbsp;0配置的完美表达各种语法单元</p> </li> \n <li> <p>最累的是和团队其它成员协同时, 其它人都是线性编辑环境,只有俺是多维表述的&nbsp;文学化编程</p> </li> \n <li> <p>所以,&nbsp;有代码修订合并时,俺都要手工合并差异,以免破坏了俺的程序表述结构.</p> </li> \n</ul> \n<h1 id=\"_5\">是也乎<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/141209-feeling-leo.html#_5\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h1> \n<p>其实,无论俺怎么分析/回答/解释,</p> \n<p>都无法替代大家自行去体验,</p> \n<p>文学化编程,</p> \n<p>是真正的将思维对应到代码内在结构上,</p> \n<p>而不是语法结构,</p> \n<p>这对程序员而言,是种极大的解放.</p> \n<h2 id=\"changlog\">Changlog<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/141209-feeling-leo.html#changlog\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<ul> \n <li>141209&nbsp;受邀回答</li> \n</ul>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 09 Dec 2014 11:42:00 +0000","feedId":2079,"bgimg":"http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/6/62/Literate_Programming_book_cover.jpg/220px-Literate_Programming_book_cover.jpg","linkMd5":"bea92412be1063d8e4651d9743355425","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn33@2020_6/2020/08/24/14-59-17-289_40d4eb860844a1ca.webp","destWidth":220,"destHeight":329,"sourceBytes":14740,"destBytes":8222,"author":"ZoomQuiet","articleImgCdnMap":{"http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/6/62/Literate_Programming_book_cover.jpg/220px-Literate_Programming_book_cover.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn33@2020_6/2020/08/24/14-59-17-289_40d4eb860844a1ca.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598281148763},{"createdTime":"2020-08-24 22:59:08","updatedTime":"2020-08-24 22:59:08","title":"Collections and Embedded Documents in MongoDB","link":"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html","description":"<h1 id=\"mongodb\">MongoDB 中的集合或嵌入式文档<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#mongodb\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h1> \n<p><img alt=\"mongo\" src=\"https://d262ilb51hltx0.cloudfront.net/max/700/1*cwCnTFQEbcUSy1KvoiIqXg.png\" /></p> \n<p>[via]&nbsp;http://fosterelli.co/collections-and-embedded-documents-in-mongodb.html</p> \n<p>When someone is approaching MongoDB from the <span class=\"caps\">SQL</span> world, a very common confusion regarding database structure is when to use embedded documents, and when to create an entirely new collection. This distinction is very important because, although MongoDB is schemaless in nature, whether or not an element of your database is structured as embedded documents or a separate collection will change your code a fair amount. Making this change later on can represent a fair amount of work, so it helps to get this right the first&nbsp;time.</p> \n<p>There is no “right answer” to this question, as it depends entirely on the situation at hand. The natural tendency of people coming from the <span class=\"caps\">SQL</span> world is to stick everything in separate collections, but often this is very unnecessary and will cause serious performance impacts. However, mistakenly placing something within another document may lead to pain further down the&nbsp;road.</p> \n<p>A set of rules I have found useful is to ask yourself the following&nbsp;questions:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Does the embedded document relate to one or more other&nbsp;collections?</li> \n <li>Will you most often need the embedded document without the parent&nbsp;document?</li> \n <li>Will you most often need the parent document without the embedded&nbsp;document?</li> \n</ul> \n<p>If the answer to two or more of these is yes, you likely will want a separate collection. If the answer to only one of these is yes, a separate collection should still be considered, but likely not&nbsp;needed.</p> \n<h2 id=\"examples\">Examples<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#examples\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<h3 id=\"comments-on-a-blog\">Comments on a blog<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#comments-on-a-blog\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h3> \n<p>You would like to create a system where people may submit comments on blog posts. The problem is that you are unsure if you should store the comment on the post document, or create a separate collection named&nbsp;comments.</p> \n<h4 id=\"does-the-embedded-document-relate-to-one-or-more-other-collections\">Does the embedded document relate to one or more other collections?<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#does-the-embedded-document-relate-to-one-or-more-other-collections\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h4> \n<p>No. A comment is typically related to only the post that it is commented on. There may be some situations where this is not true, such as if you provided comment author accounts for editing. However, even this is not a very convincing reason by itself to separate the comment into a separate&nbsp;collection.</p> \n<h4 id=\"will-you-most-often-need-the-embedded-document-without-the-parent-document\">Will you most often need the embedded document without the parent document?<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#will-you-most-often-need-the-embedded-document-without-the-parent-document\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h4> \n<p>Again, the answer is no. You likely will not often need to load a comment without also needing the context of the&nbsp;post.</p> \n<h4 id=\"will-you-most-often-need-the-parent-document-without-the-embedded-document\">Will you most often need the parent document without the embedded document?<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#will-you-most-often-need-the-parent-document-without-the-embedded-document\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h4> \n<p>In the majority of cases, the answer here is no. Most of the time you use this object, someone will be viewing a blog entry. You will want to both display the post and the comments at once, so it makes sense to fetch those&nbsp;together.</p> \n<p>Overall, comments for a blog is a very good candidate for embedded&nbsp;documents.</p> \n<h3 id=\"students-in-a-class\">Students in a class<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#students-in-a-class\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h3> \n<p>You have a school management system, and you would like to enable students to enrol in a particular class. You are unsure if you should store the student objects on the class, or create a separate collection named&nbsp;students.</p> \n<h4 id=\"does-the-embedded-document-relate-to-one-or-more-other-collections_1\">Does the embedded document relate to one or more other collections?<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#does-the-embedded-document-relate-to-one-or-more-other-collections_1\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h4> \n<p>Typically, we can assume yes. A student will likely relate to other things, such as an assignment or school object. Also, a very important note is that each embedded document will likely relate to multiple documents in the classes collection, which is a very strong hint you need a separate&nbsp;collection.</p> \n<h3 id=\"3-will-you-most-often-need-the-embedded-document-without-the-parent-document\">3 Will you most often need the embedded document without the parent document?<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#3-will-you-most-often-need-the-embedded-document-without-the-parent-document\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h3> \n<p>The answer here will often be yes. If you want any sort of student information panel or want to have students enrolled in different classes, then you will often want the student document without needing the context of each&nbsp;class.</p> \n<h4 id=\"will-you-most-often-need-the-parent-document-without-the-embedded-document_1\">Will you most often need the parent document without the embedded document?<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#will-you-most-often-need-the-parent-document-without-the-embedded-document_1\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h4> \n<p>Probably no for this one. It depends on what operation we are doing most often with the class, but I imagine that when we fetch a class we would likely need at least one student as&nbsp;well.</p> \n<p>Overall, students in a class are probably better suited for a separate collection. It’s important to keep in mind the scope of the problem you are solving with the data, and the operations that will be done most commonly. That said, a student is a very relational piece of data and better fits a separate&nbsp;collection.</p> \n<blockquote> \n <blockquote> \n  <blockquote> \n   <p>尝试翻译为中文:</p> \n  </blockquote> \n </blockquote> \n</blockquote> \n<p>如果刚刚从<span class=\"caps\">SQL</span> 世界进入 MongoDB, 最常见的困惑就是 “嵌入式文档” 以及何时创建新的”集合”? 这类困惑的根源就是还没有建立起来 MongoDB 的自由结构世界观 ;-) <span class=\"caps\">SQL</span> 世界的来客,总是试图先建立起一个完美的关系体系可以兼容以后的所有业务变化, 而&nbsp;Mongo们,则是更加愿意先将已知的数据舒服的收集起来,随着业务的理解,不断的调整结构,同时代码永远可用!</p> \n<p>那么,这里给出俺知道的判定问题:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>嵌入的文档,同其它集合有一个或以上的关联嘛?</li> \n <li>你将总会请求嵌入的文档,而 不需要&nbsp;父文档嘛?</li> \n <li>你将总会请求父文档,而 不需要&nbsp;嵌入的文档嘛?</li> \n</ul> \n<p>如果以上问题,有两个或以上回答为 yes, 那么最好使用独立的集合. 如果回答只有一个为 yes,&nbsp;那么独立集合也应该考虑,但一般不必要了.</p> \n<h2 id=\"_1\">示例<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#_1\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<h3 id=\"blog\">blog 的评注<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#blog\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h3> \n<p>你可能创建过类似blog 的系统,允许用户创建评注.问题在于你无法确定这堆评注,是存储在文章对象中呢,还是另外创建集合来保存?&nbsp;动用以上问题来考查一下… </p> \n<h4 id=\"_2\">嵌入的文档,同其它集合有一个或以上的关联嘛?<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#_2\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h4> \n<p>首先呢,评注肯定是先同当前文章有关联的. 同时也有很多其它方案, 比如想支持作者可以修订评注.&nbsp;但是,这还不足以今评注分离成独立集合.</p> \n<p>你将总会请求嵌入的文档,而 不需要&nbsp;父文档嘛?</p> \n<p>再来,如果这问题的回答是 否.&nbsp;意味着你并不想加载文章时,一定就显示评注.</p> \n<h4 id=\"_3\">你将总会请求父文档,而 不需要 嵌入的文档嘛?<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#_3\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h4> \n<p>多数情况,这个问题的回答是 否. 一般只是想显示文章, 只是有时,期望同时显示,&nbsp;那就必须让这一动作简单.</p> \n<p>综上, 评注作为 嵌入文档&nbsp;是合理的.</p> \n<h2 id=\"_4\">班级中的学生<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#_4\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<p>你有个学校管理系统, 想让学生作为特殊的一个类, 但是,不肯定是作为班级的嵌入文档呢,&nbsp;还是独立集合.</p> \n<h4 id=\"_5\">嵌入的文档,同其它集合有一个或以上的关联嘛?<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#_5\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h4> \n<p>典型的,我们回答 是 . 每个学生总是会关联各种事物,&nbsp;比如学校.同时,重要的每个嵌入文档同多个班级有关系时,这是分离为单独集合的重要暗示.</p> \n<h4 id=\"_6\">你将总会请求嵌入的文档,而 不需要 父文档嘛?<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#_6\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h4> \n<p>这问题经常回答为 是. 如果你想对学生进行多种排序,或是不同班级有不同学生参加,所以你总是想使用&nbsp;学生节点而不是班级的信息.</p> \n<h4 id=\"_7\">你将总会请求父文档,而 不需要 嵌入的文档嘛?<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/mongo-collections-embdded-think.html#_7\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h4> \n<p>这问题可能就是 否了. 这取决于我们经常怎么使用班级的数据,&nbsp;目测其实我们最常查询班级的数据就是最后那名学生是谁.</p> \n<p>综上,班级学生最好分离为独立的集合. 重要的是问题域要关注你的数据,并且令数据分布吻合常见事务要求. 即,&nbsp;学生关联那多数据,最好独立!</p> \n<p>that&nbsp;all!</p> \n<p>其实, 使用文档型NoSQL, 特别是 MongoDB, 放弃<span class=\"caps\">RMDB</span>&nbsp;那堆范式的概念,使用我们的直觉,从当前已知的常见操作出现来设计文档结构就对了!</p> \n<h2 id=\"changelog\">Changelog<a class=\"headerlink\" 通用无线扩展器&nbsp;中继器</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"_5\">体验<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/standing-desk-env.html#_5\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<h2 id=\"_6\">是也乎<a <li>160401&nbsp;动心</li> \n</ul>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 30 Apr 2016 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":2079,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"78f07f95fd01d6d84d4d99e359ca944c","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Zoom.Quiet","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598281148760},{"createdTime":"2020-08-24 22:59:08","updatedTime":"2020-08-24 22:59:08","title":"钩陈/ 什么是程序媛?","link":"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/oldtouch-codeing-lady-380s.html","description":"<p>这是大妈在 <strong>ZoomQuiet</strong> 的第<strong>009</strong>篇原创</p> \n<blockquote> \n <p>普通程序老猿一则回忆痕迹…</p> \n</blockquote> \n<hr> \n <h2 id=\"_1\">背景<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/oldtouch-codeing-lady-380s.html#_1\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n <p>蟒营™Python入门班 第6期,&nbsp;已经上线开始报名了;</p> \n <p>这个月最大的节日是 <code>三八.女神节</code>;</p> \n <p>所以,&nbsp;很早就在琢磨如何优惠;</p> \n <p>不过,&nbsp;先得明确一个问题…</p> \n <hr> \n  <h2 id=\"_2\">问题<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/oldtouch-codeing-lady-380s.html#_2\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n  <blockquote> \n   <p>为什么要给女生特别优惠?</p> \n  </blockquote> \n  <p>其实, 答案很明显,&nbsp;从俺的社区称号都可以推理出了;</p> \n  <p>为什么, 俺是 <code>大妈</code> 而不是 <code>大爷</code>?</p> \n  <p>民间也是, <code>大爷</code> 总是和骂人联系在一起, 而 <code>大妈</code> 总是有点儿亲近+耍赖的意思.</p> \n  <p>当然是因为:</p> \n  <ul> \n   <li>在家, 永远是 <code>大妈</code> 在干活</li> \n   <li>大爷们总是背着手休息…</li> \n  </ul> \n  <p>可是,&nbsp;这又是为什么呢?</p> \n  <hr> \n   <h2 id=\"_3\">分析<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/oldtouch-codeing-lady-380s.html#_3\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n   <p>其实, 人类一开始, 都是 <strong>“大妈”</strong> 掌管家族的,&nbsp;大象至今也是如此;</p> \n   <p>因为, 那时主要靠采集, 生存关键因素是食物经验, 而没有文字时, 活的长的那个性别拥有更多经验, 由 <span class=\"caps\">TA</span>&nbsp;来指挥部落生存机率高;</p> \n   <p>而从生理上, 因为女性拥有必须能承担两人以上同时消耗的生理结构, 所以, 生命力更强, 从而一般也活的更长, 进而导致 <strong>“大妈”</strong>&nbsp;们统治家族部落;</p> \n   <p>直到人类发明了武器, 从采集变成狩猎为主要营养来源时, 男性才逐渐发挥暴发力强, 以及性格上更加激进等等优势, 接替 <strong>“大妈”</strong>&nbsp;们统治家族部落;</p> \n   <p>再后来, 男性通过文字以及国家制度的发明, 设计了男尊女卑的社会文化, 才从生理优势之外,&nbsp;在社会结构中注入了额外优势;</p> \n   <p>导致女性一直在人类各种社会中处于从属状态;</p> \n   <p>凡是男性不愿意干的事儿,&nbsp;都是女性去干;</p> \n   <p>编程就是这种工作:</p> \n   <ul> \n    <li>早年, 编程中的编,&nbsp;是编织的编</li> \n    <li>因为, 那时还没有磁盘发明,&nbsp;连磁带都没有</li> \n    <li>录音机用的还是钢丝…</li> \n    <li>而程序是通过在卡片纸上打孔, 象毛衣编织机那种结构,&nbsp;再由电路转换为内存程序执行的;</li> \n    <li>但是, 在 <span class=\"caps\">NASA</span> 火箭系统中, 极端的温度变化,&nbsp;导致无论什么纸带都无法正常工作;</li> \n    <li>所以,&nbsp;只好在细线缆上通过磁环的穿过与否来记录只读程序</li> \n   </ul> \n   <blockquote> \n    <p>原理很简单:</p> \n   </blockquote> \n   <p><img alt=\"1\" src=\"http://ydlj.zoomquiet.top/ipic/2020-03-04-ScreenShot%202020-03-04%2022.45.42.jpg\" /></p> \n   <p><img alt=\"0\" src=\"http://ydlj.zoomquiet.top/ipic/2020-03-04-ScreenShot%202020-03-04%2022.45.49.jpg\" /></p> \n   <p>线选开关存储器(Core rope memory), 也有人叫它”绳索存储器”.&nbsp;实际上是一个有很多磁环构成的阵列:</p> \n   <ul> \n    <li>一根导线如果穿过了磁环则导线上的电流就会发生改变,</li> \n    <li>系统检测到这种改变后就把数据解释为1,否则就为0</li> \n   </ul> \n   <p>只能由女性编(织工)程人员,&nbsp;按照程序的二进制字符序列编织为一组组磁环和线缆形成的程序卡;</p> \n   <p><img alt=\"成品大致这样...\" src=\"http://ydlj.zoomquiet.top/ipic/2020-03-04-ScreenShot%202020-03-04%2022.43.27.jpg\" /></p> \n   <p>这事儿,&nbsp;男性干不了…</p> \n   <p>后来, 技术进步了,但是, 依然没有男性愿意去作, 因为, 坐在打字机前输入程序, 太象秘书小姐了,&nbsp;太娘了…</p> \n   <p>所以, 那个时代的程序员,&nbsp;全部是程序媛.</p> \n   <p>然后? 当然, 慢慢的, 这个行业飞速发展, 编程变成一个高大上的工作, 然后, 男性果断又重新运用文化武器, 说女性逻辑/数学/空间想象力不足,&nbsp;又重新掌握了程序员这一果然发展越来越好的职业,</p> \n   <p>于是就又变成了程序猿.</p> \n   <hr> \n    <h2 id=\"_4\">嗯哼<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/oldtouch-codeing-lady-380s.html#_4\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n    <blockquote> \n     <p>而实际上,&nbsp;女性天生适合编程的…</p> \n    </blockquote> \n    <p>不说编程发明人就是 Ada 女神了, 也不说 <span class=\"caps\">NASA</span> 早期神级程序媛, 登月系统主程以及架构师 M.Hamilton&nbsp;…</p> \n    <p><img alt=\"380\" src=\"http://ydlj.zoomquiet.top/ipic/2020-03-04-ScreenShot%202020-03-04%2023.06.42.jpg\" /></p> \n    <p>就回顾一下俺以往遇见过的程序媛吧:</p> \n    <blockquote> \n     <p>2000,&nbsp;在上海:</p> \n    </blockquote> \n    <p>那时, 刚刚毕业, 又在广告公司里蹉跎了一年, 总算通过同学介绍, 凭自学的 <span class=\"caps\">PHP</span> 进入上海一家软件公司; 遇到程序媛C ,好象是复旦数学系毕业, 自学 C++; 负责核心业务系统的开发,&nbsp;而俺不过是前端小程序猿…</p> \n    <p>自己用盗版 UltraEdit 编写 <span class=\"caps\">HTML</span>/<span class=\"caps\">JS</span>/<span class=\"caps\">CSS</span>/<span class=\"caps\">PHP</span>/… 各种脚本,&nbsp;只能跑在服务端;</p> \n    <p>而人家用正版 Visual Studio 高端复杂的 <span class=\"caps\">IDE</span>, 编写 C++&nbsp;桌面产品;</p> \n    <p>那简直是仰望星空…</p> \n    <p>当时, 还不以为然, 因为已经皈依了 <span class=\"caps\">GNU</span> ~&nbsp;自由软件原教旨主义;</p> \n    <p>但是, 后来有机会联合完成一个上海交通厅的项目, 涉及一个随机出奖的功能, 人家, 就用一晩上自学 <span class=\"caps\">PHP</span> 并设计完成了通过在一个图片所有像素中大致均匀分布中奖点的方法;&nbsp;完成了指定任意数量的随机中奖.</p> \n    <p><strong>Orz…</strong></p> \n    <blockquote> \n     <p>2004,&nbsp;北漂:</p> \n    </blockquote> \n    <p>因为自学 Python ,又在网络中参与了啄木鸟社区的创建, 从而获得进入 <span class=\"caps\">SINA</span>&nbsp;工作的机会;</p> \n    <p>进入刚刚重组的邮件技术部, 沉迷于 FreeBSD&nbsp;的全新世界;</p> \n    <p>作的是过程改进, 结果发现, 当时整个儿 <span class=\"caps\">SINA</span> 免费邮箱业务是基于定制的 <span class=\"caps\">POSTFIX</span>, 将2万行代码, 硬生生扩展到7万行包含业务逻辑的,&nbsp;是位程序媛;</p> \n    <p>开会从来不说话, 无论什么功能,&nbsp;基本上3天就能交付…</p> \n    <p>继续仰望星空…</p> \n    <p><strong>Orz…</strong></p> \n    <blockquote> \n     <p>2008,&nbsp;珠海:</p> \n    </blockquote> \n    <p>又因为 <span class=\"caps\">SINA</span> 的经历, 当时还不是集团公司的金山,&nbsp;想对研发中心进行过程改进;</p> \n    <p>于是幸运的抓住机会南下;</p> \n    <p>因为不涉及具体业务系统开发, 所以, 在实习生大批进来后,&nbsp;分配俺一个任务:</p> \n    <div class=\"highlight\"> \n     <pre><span class=\"err\">教会愿意学的实习生用</span> <span class=\"n\">Python</span>\n</pre> \n    </div> \n    <p>这就是现在蟒营™开源网络课程框架的发源,</p> \n    <p>但是, 印象深的不是俺班上的学员, 而是一位 程序媛L, 她没选择 Python , 而是坚定的去了 C++ 实习组; 毕业 Party 时, 才知道,&nbsp;原来人家的志愿就是病毒分析;</p> \n    <p>然后, 又几年过去, 她已经是病毒分析中心主任了, 现在又是两娃的妈妈; 却坚实的掌握全球几乎所有<span class=\"caps\">PC</span> 病毒特征,&nbsp;以及病毒制造工作室的代码特性痕迹;</p> \n    <p>而俺已经反复被创业变成 Indie Hacker&nbsp;来通过网课来生存了…</p> \n    <p>只能继续仰望星空…</p> \n    <p><strong>Orz…</strong></p> \n    <p>以及, 又后来, 在技术大会, 程序媛专场作主持时,&nbsp;见到全国各种领域中的程序媛,</p> \n    <p>简直仰望星空到颈断…</p> \n    <p><strong>Orz…</strong></p> \n    <hr> \n     <h2 id=\"_5\">所以<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/oldtouch-codeing-lady-380s.html#_5\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n     <p>有点不理解, 很多报名时担心自己学不会的女生,&nbsp;她们的担心哪里来的…</p> \n     <p>所以, 这个月 蟒营™Python入门班 第6期,&nbsp;决定:</p> \n     <blockquote> \n      <p>女生报名, 一律优惠 380&nbsp;元整</p> \n     </blockquote> \n     <p><img alt=\"2020-02-28-101camp6py-reg-qrcode.jpg (JPEG Image, 448 × 364 pixels)\" src=\"http://ydlj.zoomquiet.top/ipic/2020-02-28-101camp6py-reg-qrcode.jpg\" /></p> \n     <p>以此来支持 Python&nbsp;界对程序媛的渴望;-)</p> \n     <p>特别是文科生也应该学编程,&nbsp;理由很多,</p> \n     <p>简要列一下,大家自个儿选个顺眼的,刻到脑子里:</p> \n     <ul> \n      <li>让大脑二次发育</li> \n      <li>文科生会编程是件很’酷’的事情</li> \n      <li>知名记者曰过:”我觉得写一次 Python 程序之后,文科生就不会胡写中文了.&nbsp;“</li> \n      <li>李笑来的”把时间当做朋友”中曰过: \n       <ul> \n        <li>多年以来,受影响最深的,并不是当时所学的 <span class=\"caps\">BASIC</span> ,或者是后来所学的 <span class=\"caps\">PASCAL</span> ,抑或再后来学的 C,C++&nbsp;什么的;</li> \n        <li>受影响最深的是一种思考方式──在跑程序之前,要反复浏览代码,在脑子里进行预演;而不是写完程序直接跑,出错了再说.&nbsp;这是节省时间提高效率的重要方式. </li> \n       </ul> </li> \n     </ul> \n     <p>所以,对于没有任何编程自信的好人们:</p> \n     <div class=\"highlight\"> \n      <pre><span class=\"err\">学习</span> <span class=\"n\">Python</span> <span class=\"err\">的</span>\n    <span class=\"err\">目标本身</span>\n        <span class=\"err\">从来不是</span> <span class=\"n\">Python</span>\n    <span class=\"err\">而是只有通过编程思维</span>\n        <span class=\"err\">才能理解</span><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"err\">接触到的</span>\n    <span class=\"err\">真实世界的</span> <span class=\"n\">Cyber</span> <span class=\"err\">维度</span>\n</pre> \n     </div> \n     <hr> \n      <h2 id=\"refer\">refer.<a class=\"headerlink\" +0000","feedId":2079,"bgimg":"http://ydlj.zoomquiet.top/ipic/2020-03-04-ScreenShot%202020-03-04%2022.45.42.jpg","linkMd5":"280749d6ed38948bfc24c43a95c5e190","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn41@2020_6/2020/08/24/14-59-20-249_593d0f791bf0f294.webp","destWidth":492,"destHeight":308,"sourceBytes":12377,"destBytes":9004,"author":"ZoomQuiet","articleImgCdnMap":{"http://ydlj.zoomquiet.top/ipic/2020-03-04-ScreenShot%202020-03-04%2022.45.42.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn41@2020_6/2020/08/24/14-59-20-249_593d0f791bf0f294.webp","http://ydlj.zoomquiet.top/ipic/2020-03-04-ScreenShot%202020-03-04%2022.45.49.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn98@2020_5/2020/08/24/14-59-30-256_69d89c5575789ea6.webp","http://ydlj.zoomquiet.top/ipic/2020-03-04-ScreenShot%202020-03-04%2022.43.27.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn18@2020_2/2020/08/24/14-59-32-209_86b43036a6c66394.jpg","http://ydlj.zoomquiet.top/ipic/2020-03-04-ScreenShot%202020-03-04%2023.06.42.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn10@2020_4/2020/08/24/14-59-33-744_65c7d3f636ad1bf3.webp","http://ydlj.zoomquiet.top/ipic/2020-02-28-101camp6py-reg-qrcode.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn22@2020_4/2020/08/24/14-59-32-725_1a9f81c4a182d704.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598281148749},{"createdTime":"2020-08-24 22:59:08","updatedTime":"2020-08-24 22:59:08","title":"How to argue for Python’s use","link":"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/140718_Brett_Cannon-How2argue4Python-use.html","description":"<p><a href=\"http://nothingbutsnark.svbtle.com/how-to-argue-for-pythons-use\">How to argue for Python’s&nbsp;use</a></p> \n<p>Recently I wrote a blog post about how I don’t worry about Python losing users. Within minutes I had people asking about Python’s usage, which the post was not about and is a very different thing to worry about. See, it looks like the number of people using Python will continue to be high into the future, but whether Python will be used for as many projects is not guaranteed; the number of users is great and seems secure, but the number of uses of Python in projects is not nearly as&nbsp;certain.</p> \n<p>This blog post is meant to help show how Python is still very much viable for most software projects out there. I’m not going to worry about selling Python to people going up against other dynamic languages like Ruby as I think those battles tend to come down to personal taste. What this is meant for is people dealing with teammates trying to sell statically typed languages. Specifically, this post is going to be geared towards arguing against Go, but it could be any statically typed&nbsp;language.</p> \n<p><span class=\"dquo\">“</span>Why Go?”, you might ask. Well, because Go is actually gaining users at Python’s expense. Ever since Python’s growth trajectory went hockey stick starting between 2003-2005, Python itself has not been the king of the hill to unseat; it was the underdog. Traditionally Python has captured users from languages like Java and then kept them (I’m not going to argue about C++ users because typically they are have severe performance needs, need a systems language, or performance addicts and need to go into rehab). But things are different with Go. Python is now one of the top languages in terms of use out there, taking away our underdog stance. And for once there is another language out there coming from the statically typed programming language community whose productivity/performance tradeoff is good enough to convince some Python programmers to choose Go over&nbsp;Python.</p> \n<h2 id=\"go-today\">Go, today<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/140718_Brett_Cannon-How2argue4Python-use.html#go-today\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<p>I should start out saying that Go is currently my second favourite language. If I were asked to start a new project today and I couldn’t convince people to use Python I would argue for Go’s usage instead. Do not read this blog post as me saying that Go is a bad language. The key point of this blog post is to convince others that Python is very much a viable alternative to Go in the productivity/performance tradeoff game, not that Go is bad. Read this blog post as anti-Go and you’re taking something personally that you&nbsp;shouldn’t.</p> \n<p>I should mention that I use Go at work on occasion and try to follow the language’s community somewhat. Now this does not make me an expert in Go by any stretch of the imagination, but I’m not pulling knowledge out of docs and blogs posts alone either. But I am on the Python development team, so do realize that no matter how fair I try to be, inherent bias will be there to some&nbsp;extent.</p> \n<p>So, with those caveats out of the way, let’s look at what Go offers a&nbsp;programmer.</p> \n<h3 id=\"productivity\">Productivity<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/140718_Brett_Cannon-How2argue4Python-use.html#productivity\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h3> \n<p>The way I like to view Go is take your favourite dynamic programming language, start removing features that make speeding it up hard, and you end up with Go. Static typing is kept to to a minimum as it is typically only in your face at <span class=\"caps\">API</span> boundaries. Structural typing also makes things easier to work with (think of it much like duck typing). The syntax isn’t heavy-handed (although it does use curly braces). Don’t view Go as C/C++ with unsafe features removed and some productive bits added on or else you will end up frustrated (e.g. “why can’t I use the make() built-in or have varying return value counts like the map type?” is the wrong way to view the language; this is a reason why C++ programmers have not switched to Go). Really fast compile times also makes the development cycle feel more like a dynamic language than a compiled one. And some people actually prefer the verbosity gained from not having exceptions as it forces you to deal with exceptional cases instead of (accidentally) ignoring them (this is an instance of Go’s initial systems programming design showing through). Add on that the language itself is rather small and fits in your head and has strict forward-compatibility requirements for itself (you are not getting generics any time soon), and coding in Go is basically pleasant to work&nbsp;with.</p> \n<p>Being statically typed, Go gets to have tooling support fairly cheaply (it also helps the language was somewhat designed for it early on). In a shrewd move, Go made sure the core tooling needs actually come with Go itself. go fmt enforces Go’s style guidelines and also allows for refactorings through custom rules (which also make the whole “use tabs for indent” thing a non-issue since it means you set up your editor to represent tabs however you want and then go fmt makes it universally tabs for your <span class=\"caps\">VCS</span>). go fix updates code to meet changes made to the language since the last release. go get fetches dependencies and installs&nbsp;them.</p> \n<p>The last productivity perk of Go is that it statically compiles everything, making deployment simpler. This isn’t quite a big deal, though, if you are using containerization for your development and deployment. This is a big deal, though, if distribute a command-line tool as it becomes just a single file to ship instead of a collection of dependencies plus your&nbsp;code.</p> \n<h3 id=\"performance\">Performance<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/140718_Brett_Cannon-How2argue4Python-use.html#performance\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h3> \n<p>In terms of raw performance, Go does well. It’s hard to point to any one benchmark that definitely shows that Go is always the fastest choice since even the The Computer Language Benchmarks Game show some benchmarks where CPython 3 is faster. But in general you should consider Go fast enough for your needs no matter the&nbsp;work.</p> \n<p>But where Go really shines is with concurrency. Now do realize that concurrent code does not mean parallelized code which is a common misconception; concurrent code can still be single-threaded, it just makes task switching easier/better. Go has goroutines which make it dead simple to fire off code to execute concurrently. The language provides communication channels which allows for very clean message-passing style of concurrent programming if you don’t want to go down the shared memory route which is also supported. And with all of this integrated into the language it makes it second nature to write concurrent code where (easily) possible. In other words Go programs can be fast and the language tries to empower you to do that in a reasonable&nbsp;fashion.</p> \n<h2 id=\"python-today\">Python, today<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/140718_Brett_Cannon-How2argue4Python-use.html#python-today\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<p>Hopefully I have convinced you that Go is a good programming language, if for any other reason it will help dispel some people from thinking I poorly portrayed Go in this whole discussion. But let’s now discuss how the productivity/performance tradeoff looks for&nbsp;Python.</p> \n<h3 id=\"productivity_1\">Productivity<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/140718_Brett_Cannon-How2argue4Python-use.html#productivity_1\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h3> \n<p>First and foremost, Python is very easy to learn. There’s a reason why Python is currently the top choice for a teaching language at top-rated <span class=\"caps\">US</span> universities. That equates to a steady stream of new programmers already versed in the language as well as showing it’s easy to teach other programmers. I also don’t think it’s hard to convince people that you can definitely get a lot done in a few lines of Python code (the Go/Python 3 comparison shows that Python can accomplish solutions in less code than Go every time). So I would argue no one should disagree that you can be highly productive in Python, even compared to&nbsp;Go.</p> \n<p>Where people typically start to argue against Python is in tooling support. But if you look at the various tools I pointed out for Go – fmt, fix, and get – there is a Python equivalent found from the community. For style formatting that follows <span class=\"caps\">PEP</span> 8, there is pep8 for commit-check time or autopep8 if you want more go fmt style automatic rewriting. For go fix or go fmt for refactoring you could argue that 2to3 performs the same function. As for go get, Python has pip. And instead of statically compiled binaries we have venv/virtualenv or code freezing like cx_Freeze (on top of containerization like anything else). There’s even code analysis through projects like pylint. Arguing that Python can’t work for large projects due to the lack of tooling support has always seemed like a shallow argument to&nbsp;me.</p> \n<p>And if there is one place where Python definitely does well, it is in the breadth and depth of the third-party libraries and tools available as seen on PyPI (I’m sure someone somewhere is snickering that “not all of those run on Python 3”, which is true but the support is pretty darn good for Python 3 and simply continues to improve so I don’t worry about that argument, plus you can code targetting Python 2/3 simultaneously and then really not care about which version you aim for). While looking at godoc.org shows that Go is not exactly lacking in community support, Python’s age alone guarantees it has more third-party libraries available to it and will continue to do&nbsp;so.</p> \n<h3 id=\"performance_1\">Performance<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/140718_Brett_Cannon-How2argue4Python-use.html#performance_1\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h3> \n<p>Because Python has been around for so long and become so big, simply saying “Python is fast enough” doesn’t tell the whole story thanks to the various implementation options and speed-ups that are available. But before diving into <span class=\"caps\">VM</span>-level options, it should be mentioned that Python’s stdlib offers options to gain speedups. For instance, concurrent.futures a dead-simple way to execute embarrassingly parallel code concurrently. And the new asyncio makes writing asynchronous code in Python 3.3 and newer much easier. While it might not be integrated into the language like it is with Go, concurrent programming in Python is doable and not necessarily in a painful&nbsp;way.</p> \n<p>But one of the biggest ways you can influence the performance of your Python code is in your selection of <span class=\"caps\">VM</span>.</p> \n<h3 id=\"cpython-cython\">CPython + Cython<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/140718_Brett_Cannon-How2argue4Python-use.html#cpython-cython\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h3> \n<p>If you are working with a C extension module, then CPython is your best option (and if you don’t know the nomenclature, CPython is the interpreter you get at python.org). Performance is at least reasonable for most things – for some reason some people think the Python development team doesn’t care about performance which is a lie – and it is obviously going to have the newest features as CPython also acts as the language&nbsp;specification.</p> \n<p>If you do find yourself wanting a bit more speed for some inner loop code, Cython is an option with CPython. Cython will transpile your Python code into C extension code as best as possible. There are supported ways to make it allow for better C code, so it all depends on how Cython-specific you want to get. Cython also makes it easier to write C extension modules (but keep reading for an alternative that supports more than&nbsp;CPython).</p> \n<h3 id=\"pypy-cffi\">PyPy + cffi<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/140718_Brett_Cannon-How2argue4Python-use.html#pypy-cffi\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h3> \n<p>If you are not reliant on a pre-existing C extension module, then PyPy will give you the best overall performance. Its <span class=\"caps\">JIT</span> is great and the team welcomes the challenge of code that runs faster in CPython as they hate being slower as shown by speed.pypy.org. Honestly, unless PyPy doesn’t support a version of Python you really want to use – since PyPy typically lags behind by 2 versions, e.g. pypy3 currently supports Python 3.2 while 3.4 is the latest CPython release; they are always looking for donations to help with this – I would only consider not using PyPy because you rely on a pre-existing C extension module (numpy is a common reason, but even there PyPy is looking for donations to fix that&nbsp;problem).</p> \n<p>That doesn’t mean, though, that if you need to wrap some C code you can’t use PyPy. The PyPy project has another project called cffi which is meant to facilitate the wrapping of C code for use by Python code. The key benefit to using cffi is that if you use it then the C code can be used in CPython and PyPy (IronPython and Jython I believe are also working on adding support for cffi). So if you are wrapping C code I would strongly suggest you look at cffi over a hand-crafted C extension module or Cython so you can have better Python implementation support and be able to use&nbsp;PyPy.</p> \n<h2 id=\"numba\">Numba<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/140718_Brett_Cannon-How2argue4Python-use.html#numba\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<p>If you’re doing numeric work, then Numba is an option you should definitely consider. Economists are noticing its performance when it comes to scientific computing. While it won’t necessarily help out when it comes to general Python programming, Numba’s use of <span class=\"caps\">LLVM</span> to perform <span class=\"caps\">JIT</span> does help when using things such as numpy or other module in Python’s very strong scientific computing&nbsp;stack.</p> \n<h2 id=\"python-tomorrow\">Python, tomorrow<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/140718_Brett_Cannon-How2argue4Python-use.html#python-tomorrow\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<p>With all of that taken into account, Python is definitely not standing still (nor is Go, e.g. they are busy rewriting their compiler in Go and shifting things out of the linker into the compiler for even faster compilation speed). Python’s future continues to look&nbsp;bright.</p> \n<h3 id=\"productivity_2\">Productivity<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/140718_Brett_Cannon-How2argue4Python-use.html#productivity_2\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h3> \n<p>Python is an evolving language. Unlike Go, Python is willing to change the language, even in ways that won’t be backwards-compatible forever. This means Python can become even more productive over time at a faster rate than Go typically can (although until a Go 2 begins development it is unknown what kind of stance the Go team will take for language&nbsp;evolution).</p> \n<p>On the tooling front, there is work to standardize a set of function annotations for declaring types. This came up during the PyCon 2014 language summit where there was agreement that enough projects were now wanting a way to declare the expected types for function parameters and return values that using function annotations to think about standardizing on something that could maybe end up in the stdlib would be useful. The discussions have not started yet on the pytypedecl mailing list, but I know a <span class=\"caps\">PEP</span> is about to be started. This could be beneficial to not just projects like Cython and Numba where the type information could be used, but also in tooling like code analysis, refactoring,&nbsp;etc.</p> \n<h3 id=\"performance_2\">Performance<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/140718_Brett_Cannon-How2argue4Python-use.html#performance_2\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h3> \n<p>Long-term, there are two projects that could help with Python’s performance. One is a new Python <span class=\"caps\">VM</span> called Pyston. It’s very new, but its goal is to use <span class=\"caps\">LLVM</span>’s <span class=\"caps\">JIT</span> (yes, this sounds like Unladen Swallow, but <span class=\"caps\">LLVM</span>’s <span class=\"caps\">JIT</span> is better than it was back in 2009 so there’s hope the project will lead to some good&nbsp;results).</p> \n<p>But the project that really has me excited is the PyPy-<span class=\"caps\">STM</span> project. The “<span class=\"caps\">STM</span>” stands for “software transactional memory” and it basically allows Python to ditch the <span class=\"caps\">GIL</span>. The performance is now 1.2x-3x slower than PyPy which is very respectable. They are currently looking for donations to continue the work to reach the goal of pypy-stm with 2 threads is universally worth running over vanilla&nbsp;PyPy.</p> \n<h2 id=\"making-the-choice-at-least-murky\">Making the choice at least murky<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/140718_Brett_Cannon-How2argue4Python-use.html#making-the-choice-at-least-murky\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<p>Hopefully one comes out of this blog post realizing that Go is not the end-all, be-all answer to the productivity/performance tradeoff. Python definitely has great productivity perks and it is no slouch in the performance realm either, making it still my language of choice. If you find yourself potentially choosing something other than Python for a project, please make sure to stop and think about the productivity loss from not using Python and then look at the various options you have for making Python execute quickly so that you make an informed choice as to whether Python will work for your&nbsp;project.</p> \n<h2 id=\"changlog\">Changlog<a class=\"headerlink\" \n<h2 id=\"_1\">分析<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/cb3-howto-make-hmsrv.html#_1\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<p>之前类似的系统在 Ubuntu/FreeBSD&nbsp;上都折腾过,应该没有什么问题的…</p> \n<p>所以,出了各种问题,用了半个月才断断续续的折腾完!</p> \n<p>背景:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>原先家庭服务器是一台兼容<span class=\"caps\">PC</span>, FreeBSD8.2, 4G内存,1T硬盘+30G启动盘,&nbsp;已经死亡</li> \n <li>目标环境是:</li> \n <li><span class=\"caps\">CB3</span></li> \n <li>2G&nbsp;内存</li> \n <li>2G&nbsp;启动盘</li> \n <li>1T&nbsp;近线2吋盘</li> \n <li>1T&nbsp;U盘,3吋老盘,恢复数据</li> \n</ul> \n<h1 id=\"_2\">过程<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/cb3-howto-make-hmsrv.html#_2\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h1> \n<p>宏观回顾一下要点:</p> \n<ol> \n <li>nand 的系统要选择正确,否则 <span class=\"caps\">VGA</span>&nbsp;是支持不能的</li> \n <li>不作死不会死,千万别折腾不必要的功能/配置</li> \n <li>外挂硬盘以及历史数据,如果当初没有想到有迁移的这天只能辛苦人肉搬</li> \n <li>yum 越来越靠谱了,但是,还是相信 apt&nbsp;为好</li> \n</ol> \n<h2 id=\"cb\"><span class=\"caps\">CB</span> 初始化<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/cb3-howto-make-hmsrv.html#cb\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<p>参考: <a href=\"http://blog.zoomquiet.io/cbi-zq-install.html\">CBInstallfest 的体验</a> 之后,总是要一步步完成心目中的&nbsp;家服务器</p> \n<h2 id=\"_3\">系统整顿<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/cb3-howto-make-hmsrv.html#_3\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<p><span class=\"caps\">CB</span> 自制的 lubuntu&nbsp;系统,最扯的事儿是:</p> \n<div class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><span class=\"err\">居然</span>\n<span class=\"err\">没有</span>\n<span class=\"err\">默认</span>\n<span class=\"err\">安装</span>\n<span class=\"n\">SSH</span>\n</pre> \n</div> \n<p>真心让俺折腾了很久才发现这么奇葩的设计…</p> \n<p>然后进行一系列习惯环境的配置,&nbsp;特别是:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>第一时间快速 axel 以及 <a href=\"http://wiki.ubuntu.org.cn/Apt-fast\">Apt-fast</a></li> \n <li> <p>习惯的各种 shell&nbsp;别名:</p> <p>:::bash alias ses=’sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list’ alias acs=’apt-cache search’ alias agu=’sudo apt-fast update’ alias agg=’sudo apt-fast upgrade’ alias agi=’sudo apt-fast install’ alias agclean=’sudo apt-get clean &amp;&amp; sudo apt-get autoclean’ alias apse=’aptitude search’ alias apsh=’sudo aptitude show’ alias apu=’sudo aptitude update’ alias apg=’sudo aptitude safe-upgrade’ alias api=’sudo apt-get install’ alias aprm=’sudo aptitude remove’ alias apclean=’sudo aptitude autoclean’ alias ppaddkey=’sudo apt-key adv —keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com&nbsp;—recv-keys’</p> </li> \n</ul> \n<p>然后,第一时间杀灭预安装的 Apache,MySQL,<span class=\"caps\">PHP</span></p> \n<p>参考:</p> \n<ul> \n <li> <p><a href=\"http://my.oschina.net/sherwayne/blog/108685\">Ubuntu卸载Apache+Mysql+<span class=\"caps\">PHP</span> - 徐航的个人页面 -&nbsp;开源中国社区</a></p> <p>:::bash $ sudo apt-get —purge remove apache2 $ sudo apt-get —purge remove apache2.2-common $ sudo apt-get autoremove apache2 $ sudo aptitude purge mysql-server mysql-server-5.0 $ sudo apt-get autoremove php5 $ sudo rm -rf&nbsp;/var/lib/mysql</p> </li> \n</ul> \n<h3 id=\"utf8\"><span class=\"caps\">UTF8</span><a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/cb3-howto-make-hmsrv.html#utf8\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h3> \n<p>默认的: </p> \n<div class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><span class=\"nv\">$ </span>locale\n<span class=\"nv\">LANG</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">LANGUAGE</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">LC_CTYPE</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"s2\">\"POSIX\"</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">LC_NUMERIC</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"s2\">\"POSIX\"</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">LC_TIME</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"s2\">\"POSIX\"</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">LC_COLLATE</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"s2\">\"POSIX\"</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">LC_MONETARY</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"s2\">\"POSIX\"</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">LC_MESSAGES</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"s2\">\"POSIX\"</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">LC_PAPER</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"s2\">\"POSIX\"</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">LC_NAME</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"s2\">\"POSIX\"</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">LC_ADDRESS</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"s2\">\"POSIX\"</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">LC_TELEPHONE</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"s2\">\"POSIX\"</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">LC_MEASUREMENT</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"s2\">\"POSIX\"</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">LC_IDENTIFICATION</span><span class=\"o\">=</span><span class=\"s2\">\"POSIX\"</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">LC_ALL</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>\n</pre> \n</div> \n<p>参考:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"http://fruit.je/utf-8\">Using <span class=\"caps\">UTF</span>-8 in&nbsp;Debian</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"http://wiki.ubuntu.org.cn/%E4%BF%AE%E6%94%B9locale\">修改locale -&nbsp;Ubuntu中文</a></li> \n</ul> \n<p>重启后依然!</p> \n<div class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre>zoomq@cubietruck:~<span class=\"nv\">$ </span>locale\n<span class=\"nv\">LANG</span><span class=\"o\">=</span>\n<span class=\"nv\">LANGUAGE</span><span id=\"_4\">数据迁移<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/cb3-howto-make-hmsrv.html#_4\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<p>专门问过高人:</p> \n<div class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><span class=\"n\">from</span><span class=\"o\">:</span>  <span class=\"n\">Zoom</span><span class=\"o\">.</span><span class=\"na\">Quiet</span> <span class=\"o\">&lt;</span><span class=\"n\">zoom</span><span class=\"o\">.</span><span class=\"na\">quiet</span><span class=\"err\">@</span><span class=\"n\">gmail</span><span class=\"o\">.</span><span class=\"na\">com</span><span  <span class=\"n\">Mon</span><span class=\"o\">,</span> <span class=\"n\">Jan</span> <span class=\"mi\">20</span><span class=\"o\">,</span> <span class=\"mi\">2014</span> <span class=\"n\">at</span> <span class=\"mi\">4</span><span class=\"o\">:</span><span class=\"mi\">35</span> <span class=\"n\">PM</span>\n<span class=\"n\">subject</span><span class=\"o\">:</span>   <span class=\"mi\">1</span><span class=\"n\">Tb</span> <span class=\"err\">的</span><span class=\"mf\">2.5</span><span class=\"err\">吋盘给</span> <span class=\"n\">Ubuntu</span> <span class=\"err\">用应该选择什么</span><span class=\"n\">FS</span><span class=\"o\">?</span>\n</pre> \n</div> \n<p>参考: <a href=\"http://floss.zoomquiet.io/data/20110828225725/index.html\">linux下的文件系统选型 | shell’s home</a>&nbsp;以及相关的各种文档,</p> \n<p>进行了各种尝试,只能说那真是千辛万苦哪:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>老硬盘不格式化</li> \n <li>lununtu 直接/<span class=\"caps\">USB</span>加挂3吋盘 \n  <ul> \n   <li>无法对 <span class=\"caps\">UFS</span>&nbsp;进行读写</li> \n   <li>无解</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>老硬盘格式化</li> \n <li>购买了2吋 1T盘, etx4&nbsp;格式化,挂好</li> \n <li>怎么将老盘的 <span class=\"caps\">BSD</span> 文件系统中的数据迁移出来? \n  <ul> \n   <li><span class=\"caps\">MAC</span> 挂 <span class=\"caps\">UFS</span> ~&nbsp;无解</li> \n   <li>Linux 挂 <span class=\"caps\">UFS</span> ~&nbsp;失败</li> \n   <li>FreeBSD 挂 <span class=\"caps\">UFS</span> </li> \n   <li>嚓了!&nbsp;也失败!</li> \n   <li>这不科学,再换一台<span class=\"caps\">BSD</span>&nbsp;,一下子就成功了!</li> \n   <li>原来是 <span class=\"caps\">BSD</span> 8.2 和 9.1&nbsp;的系统不同导致…</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>然后,就变成: \n  <ul> \n   <li><span class=\"caps\">MAC</span> 接 1T 的专用U盘(原先用作 TimeMachine&nbsp;空间的)</li> \n   <li>再用 sshfs 远程挂上机房的 <span class=\"caps\">BSD</span>&nbsp;主机</li> \n   <li>人工识别可用数据,逐一复制</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>恢复上线</li> \n <li>所有数据在 <span class=\"caps\">MAC</span>&nbsp;专用U盘中了</li> \n <li>回家将老盘用外置U盘接上</li> \n <li>从 lununtu 中重新分区,格式化为 <code>vfat</code> \n  <ul> \n   <li><code>这是唯一一个所有系统都良好兼容的文件格式，工具又多</code> ~ shell909090&nbsp;曰过</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>然后,同样的通过网络 用 sshfs 挂上 <span class=\"caps\">CB</span>&nbsp;中的所有硬盘</li> \n <li>人工从 <span class=\"caps\">MAC</span>&nbsp;中灌回…</li> \n</ul> \n<p>整个 700多G 数据,就这样迁移到了 <span class=\"caps\">CB</span> 控制的两个硬盘共 2T&nbsp;空间中…</p> \n<h3 class=\"caps\">GDG</span>珠海 (订阅号: <span class=\"caps\">GDG</span>-ZhuHai)</li> \n       <li><span class=\"caps\">TFUG</span>珠海 (订阅号:&nbsp;ZH_TFUG)</li> \n      </ul> </li> \n     <li>历史吐糟: Chaos42 (订阅号&nbsp;PythoniCamp)</li> \n    </ul> \n    <hr /> \n   </hr> \n  </hr> \n </hr> \n</hr>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Feb 2020 03:42:00 +0000","feedId":2079,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"a427e86c16ca80b441029391a04c5fb2","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"ZoomQuiet","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598281148759},{"createdTime":"2020-08-24 22:59:08","updatedTime":"2020-08-24 22:59:08","title":"[大妈吐糟]小密圈 之功能残念集","link":"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html","description":"<h2 id=\"toc\">[<span class=\"caps\">TOC</span>]<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#toc\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<h1 id=\"_1\">[大妈吐糟]小密圈 之功能残念集<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#_1\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h1> \n<h1 id=\"_2\">唯有忍受的小密圈<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#_2\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h1> \n<p>第一时间下载/注册/安装了…然后, 没明白能干什么.. 终于阴差阳错的也发布了付费自学圈, 大家进来了,才发现: <span class=\"caps\">WTF</span>!</p> \n<h1 id=\"bug-imho\">Bug# #<span class=\"caps\">IMHO</span><a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#bug-imho\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h1> \n<h2 id=\"_3\">先夸奖<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#_3\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<ul> \n <li>和微信的关联太平滑了,简直以为是同一家公司作的 \n  <ul> \n   <li>用微信支付/认证,&nbsp;完成小密圈的进入</li> \n   <li>没有任何问题,而且异常的吻合目标人群的分布</li> \n   <li>至少,俺的所有成员,&nbsp;都是从微信群转入的</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>支付作的非常简洁,&nbsp;提供了所有必要的功能,而没有其它乱来的</li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"wtf\"><span class=\"caps\">WTF</span>!<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#wtf\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<p>~&nbsp;一堆堆的 </p> \n<ul> \n <li>app 和 网页功能竟然不是一一对应的?! \n  <ul> \n   <li>app-&gt;动态|消息</li> \n   <li>是所有小圈的综合入口 类似各种 <span class=\"caps\">CSM</span> 平台的:&nbsp;dashboard</li> \n   <li>非常好,非常有用,非常必要</li> \n   <li>居然 网页版&nbsp;没有这功能!</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>要知道: \n  <ul> \n   <li>任何时候尝试在移动设备上进行大量的文字输入,&nbsp;都是不人道的</li> \n   <li>所以, 强行要求用户这么作, 只能 <span class=\"caps\">WTF</span>!</li> \n   <li>而手机上知道动态,&nbsp;进行复稿</li> \n   <li>回到桌面, 进入对应的问题/回复&nbsp;快速输入完成交流</li> \n   <li>这是最自然的流程了</li> \n   <li>在 小密圈&nbsp;完全变成了不可能…</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<h3 id=\"uri\">虚假的 <span class=\"caps\">URI</span><a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#uri\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h3> \n<ul> \n <li>不知什么原则的设计</li> \n <li>小密圈中的所有事物(主题/回复/提问/消息/…) 都没有真正的 <span class=\"caps\">URI</span></li> \n <li>变成了一个功能页面的各种 锚点 (path/2/foo.html#/index/758548854 &lt;—&nbsp;这种)</li> \n <li>虽然地球上首先由 gmail 发明并成功了 <span class=\"caps\">SPA</span>(单网页应用)概念 \n  <ul> \n   <li>但, 那是完全的特例,&nbsp;因为作为一个私人邮箱的界面在一个页面不跳转是合理的</li> \n   <li>而且, 借助宏大的原创 <span class=\"caps\">JS</span> 库, gmail&nbsp;拥有完备的快捷键体系</li> \n   <li>可以只用键盘,完成几乎所有邮件管理的操作</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>可是, 小密圈,&nbsp;是完全隔离的不同群落的私密圈哪</li> \n <li>那么, 当我同时付费进入,以及在经营不同主题的小圈时 \n  <ul> \n   <li>这种虚<span class=\"caps\">URI</span>&nbsp;就引发了各种浏览器的错乱</li> \n   <li>比如, 无论俺在什么页面, F5/cmd+r&nbsp;刷新时</li> \n   <li>结果将是我在的所有小圈按照字母排序第一个圈子的首页</li> \n   <li>无论刷新时,&nbsp;俺在哪儿…</li> \n   <li><span class=\"caps\">WTF</span>!</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>更加可怕的是: \n  <ul> \n   <li>网页版 主题发言 的 <code>复制链接</code> 功能提供的 \n    <ul> \n     <li>https://wx.xiaomiquan.com/mweb/views/topicdetail/topicdetail.html?topic_id=…</li> \n     <li>链接,&nbsp;根本不是正常的访问链接</li> \n     <li>而是推广链接, 根本无法正常的在自己的小圈内部,&nbsp;不同文章中使用</li> \n    </ul> </li> \n   <li>而 app 中的分享: \n    <ul> \n     <li>则是单向的, 只能分享向&nbsp;微信/朋友圈</li> \n     <li>而不能获得链接/对象, 分享给&nbsp;小密圈中具体的人/主题</li> \n     <li>也就是说, 俺自己创建的多个小圈,&nbsp;也是完全隔离的</li> \n     <li>可以同时分享/发布的内容, 除了手工反复复制,&nbsp;没有任何其它办法</li> \n    </ul> </li> \n   <li>无论 app/网页, 从消息中进入主题的回复 \n    <ul> \n     <li>都看不到消息提醒的新回复</li> \n     <li>那东西,&nbsp;在可能十几屏之下呢…</li> \n    </ul> </li> \n   <li>…</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<p>也就是说,&nbsp;从根儿上:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>小密圈就是一个付费才能进入的残废的&nbsp;微信群</li> \n <li>并不是俺想象中的: 有付费功能的 gmail+邮件列表: \n  <ul> \n   <li>大家可以在手机和桌面相同的行为</li> \n   <li>来对具体的一个个主题进行讨论</li> \n   <li>并可以快速定位/切换不同的主题</li> \n   <li>…</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<p>以上, 认真使用 小密圈 42 小时后, 先宏观阐述一下体验, 然后逐一怼一下,&nbsp;要命的脑残功能们…</p> \n<h1 id=\"bug-imho_1\">Bug# #<span class=\"caps\">IMHO</span><a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#bug-imho_1\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h1> \n<blockquote> \n <p>~ 也就是说, 从根儿上:小密圈就是一个付费才能进入的残废的&nbsp;微信群</p> \n</blockquote> \n<p>这就是俺第一篇反馈的虚链接&nbsp;—&gt;</p> \n<p>https://wx.xiaomiquan.com/mweb/views/topicdetail/topicdetail.html?topic_id=222814528151&amp;secret=59ki2qvxatw9wtlb4lw31j99r348gk5k</p> \n<p>(大家可以体验一下,&nbsp;这种链接有毛用?)</p> \n<p>以上, 认真使用 小密圈 42 小时后, 先宏观阐述一下体验, 然后逐一怼一下,&nbsp;要命的脑残功能们…</p> \n<h2 id=\"markdown\">Markdown<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#markdown\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<ul> \n <li>有什么理由在 2017 年还专门不支持 md&nbsp;?</li> \n <li>有什么理由在 2017 年还专门不支持 md&nbsp;?</li> \n <li>有什么理由在 2017 年还专门不支持 md&nbsp;?</li> \n <li>好吧, 俺可以忍: \n  <ul> \n   <li>可是问题是,&nbsp;为毛在同一个应用内部竟然也有格式不统一的呢?</li> \n   <li>主题/回复&nbsp;好歹能记录并体现俺输入的回行以及缩进哪</li> \n   <li>为毛在 app 中的提问,无论怎么尝试,&nbsp;最后给出来的都是一坨挤在一起不换行的文字? </li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<h1 id=\"bug-imho_2\">Bug# #<span class=\"caps\">IMHO</span><a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#bug-imho_2\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h1> \n<h2 id=\"_4\">无法关闭的赞提醒<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#_4\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<ul> \n <li>点赞功能是 facebook 发明的 <span class=\"caps\">VP</span>&nbsp;发动机,用来提高广告价格的东西</li> \n <li>而小密圈靠的是圈内髙品质的交流</li> \n <li>点赞, 除了代表 <code>联已阅</code> 之外无论发布人还是阅读者&nbsp;都没有任何意义</li> \n <li>就是对 小密圈 也没有任何积极意义 —&gt; \n  <ul> \n   <li>要是在小密圈大家都只是点赞和微信朋友圈中点赞之交一样</li> \n   <li>那为毛要付费进入?</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>如果小密圈以聚集 1000 鉄粉 为目标 \n  <ul> \n   <li>那么应该杀掉点赞功能!</li> \n   <li>或是,最低限度,&nbsp;给俺一个选择</li> \n   <li>在配置中,&nbsp;可以关闭点赞的提醒!</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<h1 id=\"bug-imho_3\">Bug# #<span class=\"caps\">IMHO</span><a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#bug-imho_3\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h1> \n<h2 id=\"web\">冇用的 web 版<code>通知</code><a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#web\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<ul> \n <li>对比 app 中 -&gt;动态|消息: \n  <ul> \n   <li>动态可以进入俺所在所有圈和俺相关的所有场景中</li> \n   <li>消息 则是可以进入 1对1&nbsp;的留言场景</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>web 版本中 \n  <ul> \n   <li>消息&nbsp;功能消失了</li> \n   <li>也就是说禁止我们在桌面浏览器中,和同一小密圈的朋友单聊</li> \n   <li>凭什么!?</li> \n   <li>一定逼我们,在手机中以极其低下的效率来沟通?!</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>更加搞笑的是: \n  <ul> \n   <li>web-&gt;通知 和 app-&gt;动态&nbsp;是无关联的!</li> \n   <li>俺在 app-&gt;动态&nbsp;中点击浏览了相关消息</li> \n   <li>按照一般产品逻辑,&nbsp;俺的未读消息数量就应该减少一个</li> \n   <li>而且同时 web&nbsp;桌面端也应该一致的减少一个提醒计数</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>更更加搞笑的是: \n  <ul> \n   <li>web-&gt;通知&nbsp;本身根本没有所谓消息是否已读的计算</li> \n   <li>无论俺是否从 web-&gt;通知&nbsp;中点击查阅过</li> \n   <li>除非手工点击那个不知所谓的标记所有消息已读的&nbsp;icon</li> \n   <li>否则,&nbsp;永远标红在那儿</li> \n   <li><span class=\"caps\">WTF</span>!</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<p>明显 app 和 web 是两个开发团队,&nbsp;而且相互不尿…</p> \n<h1 id=\"bug-imho_4\">Bug# #<span class=\"caps\">IMHO</span><a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#bug-imho_4\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h1> \n<h2 id=\"_5\">不能修改的发言<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#_5\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<p>非常惊悚的发现:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>无论 <code>主题</code>/<code>回复</code> 嘦发布了</li> \n <li>就只能&nbsp;收藏/删除/追加标签</li> \n <li>不允许作者自己来修改自己发布的文字 \n  <ul> \n   <li>小密圈又不是 <span class=\"caps\">SVN</span>&nbsp;版本仓库</li> \n   <li>对于交流平台,&nbsp;也没有所谓历史不可悔之说哪</li> \n   <li>如果出于数据/消息系统的架构问题,最好所有行为是原子的</li> \n   <li>那俺也理解, 可是,作为作者本人 \n    <ul> \n     <li>俺在主题原文之下,追加个补丁说明&nbsp;总是是好的吧</li> \n     <li>不然,&nbsp;作者对自己的主题的补救说明</li> \n     <li>也只能挤在一堆积极奔放的回复中</li> \n     <li>可能连自己过几天都找不到了…</li> \n    </ul> </li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<p><span class=\"caps\">WTF</span>!</p> \n<h1 id=\"bug-imho_5\">Bug# #<span class=\"caps\">IMHO</span><a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#bug-imho_5\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h1> \n<h2 id=\"_6\">找不到的文章<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#_6\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<ul> \n <li>嗯哼? 这个问题,两个月前俺回答过哪, 大家也有精彩的讨论 \n  <ul> \n   <li>那么,&nbsp;怎么找到那篇圈内文章?</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>对比 github-wiki: \n  <ul> \n   <li>有 <code>_Sidebar.md</code>/<code>_Footer.md</code> 手工索引关键文章</li> \n   <li>文章内部,可以通过文件名形成 <code>WikiName</code> 式自动链接</li> \n   <li>当然, 也可以使用 md 的链接形式,&nbsp;手工链接到任意内外文章</li> \n   <li>最后, 实在找不到了,&nbsp;再搜索一下</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>小密圈 呢? 作为主持人: \n  <ul> \n   <li>标定文章为精华, 但是: \n    <ul> \n     <li>精华标多了一样找不到</li> \n     <li>更加可怕的是 精华-&gt;<code>查看全部</code></li> \n     <li>并不是精华列表,&nbsp;而是精华文章+大量回复</li> \n     <li>基本上成员积极点儿</li> \n     <li>这个界面中,前3屏第2个精华文章正文都是看不到的</li> \n    </ul> </li> \n   <li>那尝试追加分类作用的 标签 呢? \n    <ul> \n     <li>标签&nbsp;早已证明不是个好东西</li> \n     <li>任何人都可以任意追加任意内容和数量的标签</li> \n     <li>积累一定时间后</li> \n     <li>基本就无任何指导作用了</li> \n     <li>可以类比在微信中,&nbsp;对好友的标签分类…</li> \n    </ul> </li> \n   <li>…没招了,&nbsp;只能搜索了</li> \n   <li>搜索更加坑: \n    <ul> \n     <li>俺只是想找,&nbsp;当前小圈的相关文章哪</li> \n     <li>搜索,却是强壮的给出了俺所在的所有圈的所有搜索结果</li> \n     <li><span class=\"caps\">WTF</span>!</li> \n    </ul> </li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<p>总之:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>虚<span class=\"caps\">URI</span>+故意的产品设计</li> \n <li>令 小密圈 严密的倾向: \n  <ul> \n   <li>临时性的</li> \n   <li>非讨论式的</li> \n   <li>相互点赞之交式的</li> \n   <li>无法长期讨论的</li> \n   <li>…</li> \n   <li>总是就是低智型的快速沟通</li> \n   <li>想对历史讨论/发言/主题&nbsp;进行针对性的有结构的管理/索引/快速引用</li> \n   <li>是 <span class=\"caps\">WTF</span>&nbsp;的…</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<h1 id=\"bug-imho_6\">Bug# #<span class=\"caps\">IMHO</span><a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#bug-imho_6\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h1> \n<h2 id=\"_7\">怼不到的成员<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#_7\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<p>真正运营起来小密圈后,&nbsp;才发现:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>只有主持人, 才有界面可以进入成员列表 \n  <ul> \n   <li>而且这一界面, web&nbsp;桌面版是没有的</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>成员,是无法知道当前圈有多少同伴的</li> \n <li>问题来了: \n  <ul> \n   <li>要是 小密圈 禁止成员相互间秘密交流,&nbsp;俺也能理解</li> \n   <li>但是,问题是 作为主持人,&nbsp;想在桌面端私下对一组成员提醒点儿什么</li> \n   <li>竟然没招!</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>建议: \n  <ul> \n   <li>恢复微信群的逻辑吧!</li> \n   <li>将 <code>@</code> 功能给作齐全了</li> \n   <li>强制私聊变成公开聊也是好的…</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<p>现在这样不上不下的, 就佷 <span class=\"caps\">WTF</span>!</p> \n<h1 id=\"bug-imho_7\">Bug# #<span class=\"caps\">IMHO</span><a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#bug-imho_7\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h1> \n<h2 id=\"_8\">信息黑洞<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#_8\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<p>小密圈, 聚集高质量好友在一起, 长期在一起,&nbsp;当然是要搞点事儿出来的哪</p> \n<ul> \n <li>大家好容易在一起聊出来的东西</li> \n <li>竟然没有任何办法可以方便的拿出来用?!</li> \n <li>要知,&nbsp;信息天生就是自由的要流动的</li> \n <li>对比 github-wiki 无论是否付费 \n  <ul> \n   <li>都有对应的 git&nbsp;路径</li> \n   <li>可以让成员,&nbsp;分布式离线使用/完善/增补/…</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>小密圈? \n  <ul> \n   <li>没有任何文档来说明怎么使用我们在这儿碰撞出来的文字</li> \n   <li>以及也没有任何 <span class=\"caps\">API</span>&nbsp;提供的迹象</li> \n   <li>也就是说, 这是一个付费制造出来的&nbsp;信息黑洞</li> \n   <li>大家只能对最近的几篇文章,进行讨论</li> \n   <li>过去的, 甚至于现在讨论的将永远只能在&nbsp;这儿</li> \n   <li>无法快速的提取,&nbsp;以便其它组合/再创造…</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<p>所以, 俺现在是人工,&nbsp;将关键文字:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>复制到 github&nbsp;仓库中</li> \n <li>随着讨论的进行,&nbsp;在同步整理/再输出</li> \n <li>但是,这样,对小密圈的发展…呵呵</li> \n</ul> \n<h1 id=\"imho-bug\"><span class=\"caps\">IMHO</span># #Bug#<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#imho-bug\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h1> \n<h2 id=\"_9\">完全不可用的微信小应用<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#_9\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<p>如图片, 在微信的小应用版本 <code>小密圈+</code> 中 刷自己圈子的信息,&nbsp;将永远重复的将最早的消息输出…</p> \n<p>进入一种非常 Naive&nbsp;的死循环中…</p> \n<p>更加可怕的是:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>这种形式的&nbsp;小应用</li> \n <li>令付费的以为这就是小密圈本身</li> \n <li>不再下载安装&nbsp;小密圈</li> \n <li>以至各种更多功能无法使用 \n  <ul> \n   <li>如截屏</li> \n   <li>付费进入的成员</li> \n   <li>俺想直接沟通</li> \n   <li>不能…</li> \n   <li>因为从来没有登录过&nbsp;app.</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<p>所以, 小密圈 的 产品经理和其它著名产品经理一样,&nbsp;自己是从来不使用小密圈来组织产品设计的…</p> \n<h1 id=\"imho-bug_1\"><span class=\"caps\">IMHO</span># #Bug#<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#imho-bug_1\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h1> \n<h2 id=\"web_1\">web 版通知的不可用<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#web_1\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<p>如截屏, 这种只有红标,&nbsp;却没有任何内容以及链接的通知</p> \n<ul> \n <li>在桌面 web 版中,&nbsp;越来越多</li> \n <li>随着我们的深入使用</li> \n</ul> \n<p>所以, 小密圈 的 工程师和其它著名产品经理一样,&nbsp;自己是从来不使用真空的小密圈来测试的…</p> \n<h1 id=\"_10\">是也乎#<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/170403-chaos-xiaomi.html#_10\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h1>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 03 Apr 2017 11:42:00 +0000","feedId":2079,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"5dfd6cfe23cd052bfcb3baa486f0e1c2","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"ZoomQuiet","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598281148758},{"createdTime":"2020-08-24 22:59:08","updatedTime":"2020-08-24 22:59:08","title":"如何配置 rIME 支持 GitChat 规范?","link":"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/rime4gitchat.html","description":"<h2 id=\"bg\"><span class=\"caps\">BG</span><a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/rime4gitchat.html#bg\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<ul> \n <li>新年了, 发现有 <code>长徦式学习症</code> , 很多不敢肥家被逼婚的程序猿,&nbsp;宁可呆在公司一边值班一边刷课</li> \n <li>同时, GitChat 也空降新领导,&nbsp;启动叕一波作者鼓动</li> \n <li>所以, 响应号召,&nbsp;尝试分享这年几点感触</li> \n <li>只是, 没想到, 对提交文章, 有了细致要求, 任何一点不达标, 直接退稿,&nbsp;不允许发布</li> \n <li>虽然, 申述说: \n  <ul> \n   <li>通过配置输入法,&nbsp;已经有15年从来不用中文标点了</li> \n   <li>不仅在编程时杜绝了因为中文标点引发血案</li> \n   <li>同时, 也促使行文更加国际化,&nbsp;也从来没因为标点而引发误解</li> \n   <li>但是, GitChat&nbsp;方面不认为这是读者可以接受的</li> \n   <li>其它作者也劝:”从了吧,&nbsp;您就…”</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<blockquote> \n <p>所以…</p> \n</blockquote> \n<h2 id=\"goal\">goal<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/rime4gitchat.html#goal\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<ul> \n <li>找到配置,&nbsp;恢复全角标点输入</li> \n <li>同时兼容以往全部半角标点输入习惯</li> \n <li>进一步,&nbsp;是否可以用工具来完成自动化修改?</li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"logging\">logging<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/rime4gitchat.html#logging\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<blockquote> \n <p>快速记录应对嗯哼</p> \n</blockquote> \n<h3 id=\"sed\">sed<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/rime4gitchat.html#sed\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h3> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://gist.github.com/ZoomQuiet/53439dd21c60a935e793\">i hate Chinese symbol! so usage: zhmark2en.sh pwd&nbsp;FILEexNAME</a></li> \n <li>早年开始实行全半角标点后, 自然的基于 bash 编写了小工具 \n  <ul> \n   <li>可以自动用自己指定规则</li> \n   <li>替换批量文本文件中所有全角标点</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>自然首先尝试基于之, 反转规则: \n  <ul> \n   <li>还用之前输入习惯</li> \n   <li>只是提交前,&nbsp;用工具自动替换所有半角标点为编辑们渴望和依赖的中文标点</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<blockquote> \n <p>结果-&gt;放弃</p> \n</blockquote> \n<ul> \n <li>首先, 中文标点有很大一批是成对却不同形状 <code>\"\"　\"　\"</code> \n  <ul> \n   <li>原先工具替换时是统一替换为同一形状</li> \n   <li>比如,无论 <code>\"</code> 或是 <code>\"</code> 都嗯哼为 <code>\"</code></li> \n   <li>现在想相反,&nbsp;远没那么简单</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>另外, 原先替换的目标字符在 <span class=\"caps\">ASCII</span> 范畴, 无论什么编码都兼容 \n  <ul> \n   <li>现在则不同,&nbsp;中文标点只存在少数几种编码中</li> \n   <li>用 shell&nbsp;脚本强行修改后</li> \n   <li>引发编码混乱,&nbsp;文本直接乱码了</li> \n   <li>强行转换回 <span class=\"caps\">UTF</span>-8&nbsp;依然有很大比例有吞字现象</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<h3 id=\"rime\">rIME<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/rime4gitchat.html#rime\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h3> \n<blockquote> \n <p>只能回到输入法本身来定制了</p> \n</blockquote> \n<p>好在 <a href=\"https://rime.im/\"><span class=\"caps\">RIME</span> - 中州韻輸入法引擎</a>&nbsp;本身就是高度可定制的</p> \n<ul> \n <li>参考: <a href=\"https://github.com/ZoomQuiet/ZqBXM/tree/master/Rime-Squirrel\">ZqBXM/Rime-Squirrel at master ·&nbsp;ZoomQuiet/ZqBXM</a></li> \n <li>发现当年关键几处配置</li> \n <li>小心尝试几次,&nbsp;便搞定</li> \n</ul> \n<p>:</p> \n<div class=\"highlight\"> \n <pre><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"n\">Users</span><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"n\">zoomq</span><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"n\">Library</span><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"n\">Rime</span><span class=\"o\">/</span>\n    <span class=\"o\">+-</span> <span class=\"n\">alternative</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"n\">yaml</span>  <span class=\"o\">~</span> <span class=\"err\">全</span><span class=\"o\">/</span><span class=\"err\">半角标点声明</span>\n    <span class=\"o\">+-</span> <span class=\"p\">...</span> \n    <span class=\"o\">+-</span> <span class=\"n\">bxm4zq2mac</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"n\">custom</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"n\">yaml</span> <span class=\"o\">~</span> <span class=\"err\">私制</span> <span class=\"err\">表形码</span> <span class=\"err\">输入法定制配置</span>\n    <span class=\"o\">+-</span> <span class=\"n\">bxm4zq2mac</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"n\">schema</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"n\">yaml</span> <span class=\"o\">~</span> <span class=\"err\">私制</span> <span class=\"err\">表形码</span> <span class=\"err\">输入法行为配置</span>\n    <span class=\"o\">+-</span> <span class=\"p\">...</span>\n    <span class=\"err\">`</span><span class=\"o\">-</span> <span class=\"n\">user</span><span class=\"p\">.</span><span class=\"n\">yaml</span> <span class=\"o\">~</span> <span class=\"err\">通用输入行为配置</span>\n</pre> \n</div> \n<ul> \n <li>其它配置都不用动</li> \n <li>单单在 <code>user.yaml</code> 中 \n  <ul> \n   <li><code>ascii_punct: true</code> </li> \n   <li><code>full_shape: false</code></li> \n   <li>这两个配置反转就好</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"gitchat-style\">GitChat-style<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/rime4gitchat.html#gitchat-style\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<blockquote> \n <p>饭桶式写作输入</p> \n</blockquote> \n<ul> \n <li>原先 rIME 配合私制 <code>表形码</code> 进行写作和编程时, 行为很简洁: \n  <ul> \n   <li><code>control+空格</code>　切换到 <code>鼠鬚管</code> (中州韻 输入法平台 macOS 版本代号) \n    <ul> \n     <li>随便输入就好…</li> \n    </ul> </li> \n   <li>如果有大段英文输入, 不想触发中文选字 \n    <ul> \n     <li><code>shift</code> 切换状态, 或 <code>option+~</code> 选择输入状态</li> \n    </ul> </li> \n   <li>以上</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>现在, 为了兼容编辑们的期待, 行为就业务性冗余了: \n  <ul> \n   <li>输入正文时, 必须: \n    <ul> \n     <li><code>shift</code> 切换为中文输入模式</li> \n     <li>再用 <code>shift+空格</code> 切换为到 <code>全角</code> 标点</li> \n     <li>此时, 所有标点是<code>中文式</code>的</li> \n    </ul> </li> \n   <li>输入 markdown 相关结构字符时, 又必须: \n    <ul> \n     <li><code>shift</code> 切换为中文输入模式</li> \n     <li>再用 <code>shift+空格</code> 切换为到 <code>半角</code> 标点</li> \n     <li>此时, 类似 <code>+ - &gt;</code> 以及空格/tab 都是 <span class=\"caps\">ASCII</span> 式, markdown&nbsp;可理解的</li> \n    </ul> </li> \n   <li>输入英文单词/术语时, 又必须: \n    <ul> \n     <li><code>shift</code> 切换为中文输入模式</li> \n     <li>再用 <code>shift+空格</code> 切换为到 <code>半角</code> 标点</li> \n     <li>再用 <code>shift</code> 切换为 en&nbsp;输入模式</li> \n     <li>此时, 才能输入正常 <span class=\"caps\">ASCII</span>&nbsp;字符</li> \n     <li>否则是类似 <code>ＡＳＣＩＩ</code>　全角英文</li> \n    </ul> </li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<p>综上, rIME&nbsp;支持灵活丰富的输入模式:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>可是为了灵活,&nbsp;不得不劳累用户显式指令切换模式</li> \n <li>同时, 从法理上不同输入模式中, <span class=\"caps\">ASCII</span>&nbsp;字符形态是不兼容</li> \n <li>而 GitChat 编辑又要求在同一篇文章中: \n  <ul> \n   <li>不同格式标点,空格</li> \n   <li>和不同形式字符</li> \n   <li>又必须 <code>合理? 美观? 合规?</code> 并举</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>导致至少多出一倍毫无必要的击键操作</li> \n <li>以及,&nbsp;和以往主要输入行为完全不同的心智判定损耗</li> \n <li>可以说, 是 <code>GitChat 式工伤</code></li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"refer\">refer<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/rime4gitchat.html#refer\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h2> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://gitbook.cn/books/5c47da3ef79c0c1f90492403/index.html\">Chat&nbsp;发布与写作指南</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"http://w3c.github.io/clreq/zh/\">中文排版需求</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a href=\"http://devrel.zoomquiet.top/data/20150402184838/index.html\">从”中文排版规范”开始</a></li> \n   <li>对比: <a href=\"https://www.w3.org/TR/jlreq/\">Requirements for Japanese Text&nbsp;Layout</a></li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li><a href=\"https://github.com/sparanoid/chinese-copywriting-guidelines/blob/master/README.md#%E7%A9%BA%E6%A0%BC\">中文文案排版指北</a> \n  <ul> \n   <li><a 的中性纸上无论怎么折腾,都好象在进行原画探索似的,特别适合用&nbsp;思维导图的形式来快速记要/安排/追踪每日事务</li> \n   <li>这一组合,一用,就再也丢不了了,,,</li> \n   <li>唯一问题就是 <span class=\"caps\">LAMY</span> safari 有点粗,夹在本子中有点伤,但是,因为是横版 A6&nbsp;幅面,很难找到合适妥贴的外挂形式,,,继续寻找中.</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n</ul> \n<h3 id=\"4\">4 近期内最想要什么产品?或者在关注的事物?<a class=\"headerlink\" href=\"https://blog.zoomquiet.io/knewone-talk-zoomq-choise.html#4\" title=\"Permanent link\">¶</a></h3> \n<p>长期口水,但是,老婆不给预算的:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><span class=\"caps\">HHKB</span> pro ~&nbsp;只要是程序猿,没人不想要的吧</li> \n <li>Herman Miller Aeron ~&nbsp;同上</li> \n <li><span <span class=\"caps\">GR1</span> , <span class=\"caps\">GRD4</span> 的 F1.9&nbsp;实在更加有力</li> \n <li><span class=\"caps\">MINI</span> Cooper ~&nbsp;这个只能梦中了,,,现在驾照都没有…</li> \n</ul> \n<h2 id=\"_2\">参考<a
